body: That is an indication that it fails with certain conditions. Any idea on what conditions these may be?
At first glance, it cannot be less than 50.0, unless it is time traveler.
That is the thing with concurrency issues. They are very similar to time travelers.

issue.title: Request::getUserIP() secure fix #17573

repository.name: yii2

body:
There is a bigger difference:
```
1) yiiunit\framework\mutex\RetryAcquireTraitTest::testRetryAcquire
Failed asserting that 48.61307144165039 is equal to 50 or is greater than 50.
C:\projects\yii2\tests\framework\mutex\RetryAcquireTraitTest.php:45
```
I don't think it is correct to ignore it in tests. I've reproduced it. Trying to understand what actually happens.

issue.title: Fix #17533: Fix mutex testRetryAcquire() on Windows

body: OMG, seems Windows `usleep()` precision is awful: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/samdark/yii2/builds/27850232. It finished 2ms earlier than specified.

Aha. That is normal on Windows: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/synchapi/nf-synchapi-sleep?redirectedfrom=MSDN

> If dwMilliseconds is less than the resolution of the system clock, the thread may sleep for less than the specified length of time.
